pullRequest.body:
Add a section about `EReal` in the file `MeasureTheory.Constructions.BorelSpace.Real.lean` with the instances for the measurability of the sum and multiplication between two extended real numbers as well as some lemmas that are needed for the proofs.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #17082
- [x] depends on: #18286
- [x] depends on: #18287
- [x] depends on: #18301

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : MeasurableAddâ‚‚ EReal := âŸ¨EReal.lowerSemicontinuous_add.measurableâŸ©`
`+ instance : MeasurableMulâ‚‚ EReal := by`
`+ lowerSemicontinuous_add`
`+ measurableEmbedding_coe`
`+ measurable_from_prod_countable''`
`+ measurable_of_real_prod`
`+ measurable_of_real_real`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I found a more conceptual approach that makes your proofs cleaner. However I just stumbled upon the fact that `MeasureTheory.Constructions.Prod.Basic` meshes the construction of the product measure with results about the product sigma algebra. I will split it first.
@YaelDillies Can you please revert that last commit and leave the PR in a clean state while you are preparing for your possible alternative proof?
Sorry, it was not very clean of me, but I knew the proof was very close and I didn't want to include the diff of #18286 in this PR, so I simply waited a few hours. The new proof is now complete.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17082~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18286~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18287~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18301~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Marking as awaiting-author because it does not build.
Apologies, I didn't see it didn't build. The fix was quite trivial.
I am the author of most of the code Lorenzo PRed (before YaÃ«l's modifications), so I won't review this myself.
Looks good, thanks!
Looks good, thanks!
People oscillate between zero and one newlines between section ends, but certainly not two
Done, thanks.

Does `fun_prop` accept lemmas like that?
```suggestion
@[fun_prop]
lemma measurable_of_measurable_real_real {f : EReal Ã— EReal â†’ Î²}
    (h_real : Measurable fun p : â„ Ã— â„ â†¦ f (p.1, p.2))
    (h_bot_left : Measurable fun r : â„ â†¦ f (âŠ¥, r))
    (h_top_left : Measurable fun r : â„ â†¦ f (âŠ¤, r))
    (h_bot_right : Measurable fun r : â„ â†¦ f (r, âŠ¥))
    (h_top_right : Measurable fun r : â„ â†¦ f (r, âŠ¤)) :
    Measurable f := by
```
It does not seem to work, at least not out of the box (I tried formulating the same lemma as an example, with the same hypotheses and thesis, and fun_prop does not manage to prove it).

I might call that
```suggestion
lemma measurable_of_real_prod {f : EReal Ã— Î² â†’ Î³}
```
instead. Same below
Done, thanks.
You will need to merge master as this lemma name is now linted against
Done, thanks.
... and this instance is already on master
We have merged master. Thanks.
Could you move this to a better place? This has nothing to do with measure theory.
instead of primes, could you use `_left` and `_right`?

pullRequest.title: feat: measurability of addition and multiplication on `EReal`
